nodes.title: Article 12
nodes.summary:
This partial document is the concluding section of an inter-ministerial order (Arrêté) from the Democratic Republic of Congo, dated August 22, 2008. The main points covered are:

1.  **Designation of Responsible Authorities:** It names the specific senior officials (the Secretary General for Mines, the Managing Directors of the CEEC and OFIDA, the Directors General of Taxes and the DGRAD) who are charged with executing the order.
2.  **Entry into Force:** It states that the order comes into effect on the date of its signature.
3.  **Signatories:** It is signed by the Minister of Finance and the Minister of Mines.
4.  **Document Reference:** It identifies itself as an annex to a specific inter-ministerial order (n°0495/... and n°195/...) which establishes the performance requirements and the customs, tax, and para-fiscal regime for artisanal miners, traders, buying offices, and processing entities for artisanally produced minerals.
5.  **Disclaimer:** The text includes a website disclaimer noting that the document is a reproduction from association records and that those associations are not legally responsible for its content.

nodes.title: Article 2
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the specific tax and duty obligations applicable under the mining regime. It lists the various real taxes, income taxes, and customs duties that must be declared and paid, referencing relevant sections of the Mining Code and Mining Regulations.

nodes.title: Article 3
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the legal framework for tax rates, duties, and fees applicable to artisanal mining operators, traders, purchasing offices, and processing entities. It specifies that these rates are set by a 2007 interministerial decree and are detailed in an annex table. It notes a specific increase in the export tax on diamonds to 2.5%. It also mentions that export duties payable to customs (OFIDA) and a community tax for decentralized territorial entities are included in the same annex.

nodes.title: Article 5
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines Article 5 of a regulation, which establishes minimum quarterly performance targets for purchasing counters and individual buyers of artisanally-produced minerals. The specified minerals are diamonds (in USD value), cassiterite, coltan, and wolframite (in tonnes). Targets are broken down for each quarter of the year for both the comptoir (counter) and the acheteur (buyer). The document also states that from the eleventh buyer onward, the counter's aggregate performance target will be adjusted proportionally based on the increase in additional buyers, and that performance control is conducted at the end of each quarter and at the end of the fiscal year.
